title: 超越传统钓鱼：AI与深度伪造技术如何驱动新一代诈骗
title_translated: Beyond Traditional Fishing: How AI and Deepfake Technology Drive a New Generation of Scams
summary: Cybercriminals are increasingly using AI, deepfakes, and advanced social engineering techniques to execute sophisticated phishing scams that mimic genuine communications. These tactics include creating flawless emails and cloned websites, as well as using deepfake technology to impersonate trusted figures, leading to significant risks for victims. The shift towards obtaining biometric data and exploiting legitimate services poses a serious threat to security.

title: 黑客论坛兜售1580万组PayPal明文凭证，或源自信息窃取恶意软件
title_translated: A hacker forum is selling 15.8 million plaintext PayPal credentials, possibly sourced from information-stealing malware.
summary: A threat actor is selling a dataset containing over 15.8 million PayPal credentials, including email-password combinations and associated URLs, which could facilitate automated login attacks. The authenticity of the data remains unverified, but if legitimate, it represents a significant security risk for users across multiple email service providers.

title: 提示词中间人攻击：威胁ChatGPT等AI系统的隐形威胁
title_translated: Prompt Injection Attacks: The Invisible Threat to AI Systems like ChatGPT
summary: "Man-in-the-Prompt" attacks exploit vulnerabilities in browser extensions to access and manipulate prompts in AI tools like ChatGPT and Gemini, potentially leading to data theft and information leaks. This threat is particularly concerning for enterprise users, as 99% have at least one extension installed, increasing risk exposure.

title: Microsoft Office Excel Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
title_translated: Microsoft Office Excel Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
summary: Microsoft Office Excel has a remote code execution vulnerability that can be exploited by opening a specially crafted Excel file. This file may be delivered via email or hosted on malicious websites, allowing attackers to execute remote code on affected systems.

title: Alma Linux: CVE-2025-6558: Important: webkit2gtk3 security update (Multiple Advisories)
title_translated: Alma Linux: CVE-2025-6558: Important: webkit2gtk3 security update (Multiple Advisories)
summary: A vulnerability in ANGLE and GPU components of Google Chrome prior to version 138.0.7204.157 allows remote attackers to potentially escape the sandbox through a specially crafted HTML page. This poses a significant risk as it could lead to unauthorized access to system resources.

title: Группировка Kinsing впервые провела масштабные атаки в России
title_translated: The Kinsing group has conducted large-scale attacks in Russia for the first time.
summary: The Kinsing group has launched a series of attacks targeting Russian companies in the financial, logistics, and telecom sectors, aiming to infect servers with malware for cryptocurrency mining. The exploitation process involves identifying software vulnerabilities to deploy malicious code, leading to performance degradation and equipment wear.

title: N-able N-Central Command Injection Vulnerability
summary: N-able N-Central has a command injection vulnerability due to improper sanitization of user input, which could allow attackers to execute arbitrary commands. Users are advised to apply mitigations as per vendor instructions or discontinue use if mitigations are unavailable.

title: N-able N-Central Insecure Deserialization Vulnerability
summary: N-able N-Central has an insecure deserialization vulnerability that may allow for command execution. Users are advised to apply mitigations as per vendor instructions or discontinue use if mitigations are not available.

title: RARLAB WinRAR Path Traversal Vulnerability
summary: RARLAB WinRAR has a path traversal vulnerability in its Windows version that could allow attackers to execute arbitrary code through malicious archive files. Users are advised to apply vendor mitigations or discontinue use if no mitigations are available.

title: Microsoft Internet Explorer Resource Management Errors Vulnerability
title_translated: Microsoft Internet Explorer Resource Management Errors Vulnerability
summary: Microsoft Internet Explorer has a memory corruption vulnerability that enables remote code execution. Users are advised to discontinue use of the product or apply mitigations as per vendor instructions, especially since the affected products may be end-of-life or end-of-service.
